definition: brains
brain/mind/head/essence
juice
to rack one's brains
to rack one's brains

sentences.english: I think brainbarfing is a more natural way to come up with writing material.
sentences.chinese: 我认为绞尽脑汁是一种采集写作素材更自然的方法。

sentences.english: B: They have racked their brain.
He tussled all night with the figures, but couldn't balance the account.
sentences.chinese: 他绞尽脑汁算了一夜也没把帐算清。

sentences.english: Simon racked his brain. Then he had an idea.
sentences.chinese: 西蒙绞尽了脑汁，终于想出了一个好办法。

sentences.english: The students there were working hard. They rack their brains tackling difficult scientific problems.
sentences.chinese: 学生在那儿苦读，绞尽脑汁地解决科学难题。

sentences.english: But don't agonize over what to write.
sentences.chinese: 但是，不要绞尽脑汁来想到底写什么。

sentences.english: Actually I have wracked my mind and heart for what I ought to say to you today.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，我为今天应该合大家谈些什么绞尽了脑汁。

sentences.english: Even after racking his brains he couldn't think of a single example.
sentences.chinese: 即便绞尽脑汁，他还是连一个例女也念不出来。

sentences.english: Is it worthwhile to cudgel your brains to find a solution to that puzzle on the newspaper?
sentences.chinese: 你这样绞尽脑汁去解决报上的那个智力测验题值得吗？

sentences.english: Are you looking for ways to make quick cash?
sentences.chinese: 你在为如何赚快钱而绞尽脑汁？

sentences.english: The scientist has worried at the problem during the last two months.
sentences.chinese: 科学工作者在过去的两个月里绞尽脑汁攻克难题。

sentences.english: They have studied the way of touting votes.
sentences.chinese: 他们在如何拉选票上绞尽了脑汁。

sentences.english: Both directors and performers rack their brains during writing and rehearsals.
sentences.chinese: 导演和演员们绞尽脑汁地进行节目的编排。

sentences.english: No guts, but this writing is also racked their brains.
sentences.chinese: 没有胆量，而且写稿时也是绞尽脑汁。

sentences.english: I racked my brains trying to solve the mathematical problem.
sentences.chinese: 为解这道数学题，我绞尽了脑汁。

sentences.english: You are at your wits' end and have begun to dread meal times.
sentences.chinese: 你为此绞尽脑汁并且开始害怕吃饭时间的到来。

definition: to rack one's brains
to search one's guts and belly (idiom); to racks one's brains for a solution
to dig for thoughts (idiom); to search everything for an answer/to rack one's brains
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
to rack one's brains
to consider from all angles (idiom); to think hard/to rack one's brains
to rack one's brains (for apt wording etc) (idiom)
to consider from all angles (idiom); to think hard/to rack one's brains
to rack one's brains for schemes (idiom)/to beat one's brains out
to exhaust one's thoughts and ingenuity (idiom); to think sth through thoroughly/to rack one's brains/to leave no stone unturned
to give it your all/to go at it with all you've got/to throw your whole weight behind it/also pr. [hun2 shen1 jie3 shu4]
to take a lot of trouble (idiom); painstaking/at the cost of a lot of effort
to figure out/to work out (a solution etc)/to think up/to come up with (an idea etc)
tremendous strength (idiom)
pinyin: jiu3 niu2 er4 hu3 zhi1 li4

definition: to turn over in one's mind (idiom); to think through from different angles/to ponder
to tweak one's ears and scratch one's cheeks (as an expression of anxiety, delight, frustration etc) (idiom)
